title: What Batman gadgets would simply not be viable in real life? - Quora

response.answer_text: Shockingly: Bat Shark Repellent may actually work, with the scent of dead sharks being shown to (possibly) drive off sharks:  But besides that there isn’t a whole lot of realism in his kit. His grappling hook is too small, his batmobile is pretty unrealistic in most incarnations. But seriously: The batarang seems mundane enough but he has several incarnations that are BEYOND RIDICULOUS  On his wall we can see a batarang with a flash bulb and another with a bomb. But that’s not what’s ridiculous. That item he’s revealing? The BATARANG X.  Yup…. he fires it off and rides it through the night. Just… no…

Personally, I find the grappling gun to be ridiculous. Whether it’s the films or the comics, Batman performs feats that would be dangerous to execute, and cause permanent damage to his body. Of course, it’s comic book physics so I ignore it. The other thing is any kind of knockout gas in his utility belt. Medically speaking, you have to know what the target’s weight, health (asthma for example) and other factors) before you can dose someone. Otherwise it’s hit and miss. Recall the Russian rescue operation where they took out people holding hostages in a theater. The Russians gassed everyone then had to administer some sort of countermeasure and hostages still died.
